greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest k>=1 such that 2*prime(n) - k^2 is semiprime (or 0 if there is no such k).
example: Let n=22, then 2*prime(22) = 2*79 = 158. We have 158-1=157, 158-4=154, 158-9=149, 158-16=142, and only the last number is semiprime. So a(22)=4.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {k = 1; while ((v = 2*prime(n) - k^2) && (v > 0) && (bigomega(v) != 2), k++); if (v <= 0, 0, k);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 25 2014
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 25 2014
